meanings.definition: Shaped like a circle or sphere
meanings.sent1: The moon looks round in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The table has a round top.
meanings.sent3: The round cookie jar sat on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: Her face lit up with a round smile.
meanings.sent5: The round balloon floated gracefully in the air.

meanings.sent1: She found a shiny round coin on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The wheel on the bike is perfectly round.
meanings.sent3: The kids played catch with a round ball in the park.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the round hill.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful round on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To make something into a circle or sphere
meanings.sent1: She likes to round the edges of the paper.
meanings.sent2: Please round the dough into small balls.
meanings.sent3: He decided to round the cake for a special occasion.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor will round the marble into a statue.
meanings.sent5: The potter will round the clay into a vase.

meanings.definition: To move in a circular direction
meanings.sent1: The dancers round the stage gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The car will round the corner slowly.
meanings.sent3: The birds round in the sky before landing.
meanings.sent4: The river will round the bend ahead.
meanings.sent5: The wind will round the leaves in the garden.
